vulnerabilities.description:
request@2.40.0 has a medium severity vulnerability identified by GHSA-7xfp-9c55-5vqj: Remote Memory Exposure in request. This vulnerability was fixed in version 2.68.0.
request@2.40.0 is a transitive dependency of node-app@1.0.0 via external direct dependency 28@3.4.0. request@2.40.0 is a transitive dependency of 28@3.4.0.
vulnerabilities.detail: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as medium severity according to the information in OSV.dev.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: No newer versions of 28 (current: 3.4.0, latest: 3.4.0) require request 2.68.0 or higher. Consider other options to upgrade request to 2.68.0 (current: 2.40.0, latest: 3.0.5).

vulnerabilities.description:
qs@1.0.2 has a high severity vulnerability identified by GHSA-hrpp-h998-j3pp: qs vulnerable to Prototype Pollution. This vulnerability was fixed in version 6.2.4.
qs@1.0.2 is a transitive dependency of node-app@1.0.0 via external direct dependency 28@3.4.0. qs@1.0.2 is a transitive dependency of 28@3.4.0.
vulnerabilities.detail: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as high severity according to the information in OSV.dev.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: No newer versions of 28 (current: 3.4.0, latest: 3.4.0) require qs 6.2.4 or higher. Consider other options to upgrade qs to 6.2.4 (current: 1.0.2, latest: 6.13.0).

vulnerabilities.description:
request@2.88.2 has a medium severity vulnerability identified by GHSA-p8p7-x288-28g6: Server-Side Request Forgery in Request. There is no known fix for this vulnerability at this time.
request@2.88.2 is a transitive dependency of node-app@1.0.0 via external direct dependency 28@3.4.0.
vulnerabilities.detail: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as medium severity according to the information in OSV.dev.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: No patch upgrades available to fix the issue. Check the security advisory for alternative controls or actions.

vulnerabilities.description:
ansi-regex@0.2.1 has a high severity vulnerability identified by GHSA-93q8-gq69-wqmw: Inefficient Regular Expression Complexity in chalk/ansi-regex. This vulnerability was fixed in version 6.0.1.
2 packages import ansi-regex@0.2.1 directly. See the list of all dependency paths for details.
vulnerabilities.detail: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as high severity according to the information in OSV.dev.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Upgrade ansi-regex to version 6.0.1 (current: 0.2.1, latest: 6.1.0).

vulnerabilities.description:

3 packages import hoek@0.9.1 directly. See the list of all dependency paths for details.
vulnerabilities.detail: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as high severity according to the information in OSV.dev.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Upgrade hoek to version 4.2.1 (current: 0.9.1, latest: 6.1.3).

vulnerabilities.description:
got@3.3.1 has a medium severity vulnerability identified by GHSA-pfrx-2q88-qq97: Got allows a redirect to a UNIX socket. This vulnerability was fixed in version 11.8.5.
got@3.3.1 is a transitive dependency of node-app@1.0.0 via external direct dependency 28@3.4.0. got@3.3.1 is a transitive dependency of 28@3.4.0.
vulnerabilities.detail: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as medium severity according to the information in OSV.dev.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: No newer versions of 28 (current: 3.4.0, latest: 3.4.0) require got 11.8.5 or higher. Consider other options to upgrade got to 11.8.5 (current: 3.3.1, latest: 14.4.2).

vulnerabilities.description:
path-to-regexp@0.1.7 has a medium severity vulnerability identified by GHSA-9wv6-86v2-598j: path-to-regexp outputs backtracking regular expressions. This vulnerability was fixed in version 0.1.10.
path-to-regexp@0.1.7 is a transitive dependency of node-app@1.0.0 via external direct dependency express@4.19.2.
vulnerabilities.detail: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as medium severity according to the information in OSV.dev.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Check if you can use a newer version of express (current: 4.19.2, latest: 5.0.0) that requires path-to-regexp 0.1.10 or higher (current: 0.1.7, latest: 8.1.0). See for example express@4.20.0 (path-to-regexp@0.1.10), express@4.21.0 (path-to-regexp@0.1.10), express@5.0.0-beta.1 (path-to-regexp@3.2.0), or latest version express@5.0.0 (path-to-regexp@8.1.0).

vulnerabilities.description:
serve-static@1.15.0 has a medium severity vulnerability identified by GHSA-cm22-4g7w-348p: serve-static vulnerable to template injection that can lead to XSS. This vulnerability was fixed in version 1.16.0.
serve-static@1.15.0 is a transitive dependency of node-app@1.0.0 via external direct dependency express@4.19.2.
vulnerabilities.detail: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as medium severity according to the information in OSV.dev.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Check if you can use a newer version of express (current: 4.19.2, latest: 5.0.0) that requires serve-static 1.16.0 or higher (current: 1.15.0, latest: 2.1.0). See for example express@4.20.0 (serve-static@1.16.0), express@4.21.0 (serve-static@1.16.2), express@5.0.0-beta.1 (serve-static@2.0.0-beta.1), or latest version express@5.0.0 (serve-static@2.1.0).

merge@1.2.1 is a transitive dependency of node-app@1.0.0 via external direct dependency 28@3.4.0. merge@1.2.1 is a transitive dependency of 28@3.4.0.

vulnerabilities.description:
hoek@0.9.1 has a high severity vulnerability identified by GHSA-c429-5p7v-vgjp: hoek subject to prototype pollution via the clone function.. There is no known fix for this vulnerability at this time.
3 packages import hoek@0.9.1 directly. See the list of all dependency paths for details.
vulnerabilities.detail: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as high severity according to the information in OSV.dev.

vulnerabilities.description:
body-parser@1.20.2 has a high severity vulnerability identified by GHSA-qwcr-r2fm-qrc7: body-parser vulnerable to denial of service when url encoding is enabled. This vulnerability was fixed in version 1.20.3.
body-parser@1.20.2 is a transitive dependency of node-app@1.0.0 via external direct dependency express@4.19.2.
vulnerabilities.detail: This package version contains a vulnerability that has been marked as high severity according to the information in OSV.dev.
vulnerabilities.recommendation: Check if you can use a newer version of express (current: 4.19.2, latest: 5.0.0) that requires body-parser 1.20.3 or higher (current: 1.20.2, latest: 2.0.1). See for example express@4.20.0 (body-parser@1.20.3), express@4.21.0 (body-parser@1.20.3), express@5.0.0-beta.1 (body-parser@2.0.0-beta.1), or latest version express@5.0.0 (body-parser@2.0.1).
